data.title: Yes, David Cameron, your country needs you . . . to never show your face again
data.meta_description: What do you get up to when bored? I tend to wander around the house killing wasps with an elastic band: zap — taste rubber death, you smug little bastards. data.text:
What do you get up to when bored? I tend to wander around the house killing wasps with an elastic band: zap — taste rubber death, you smug little bastards. Sometimes I make up crossword clues: “Former prime minister over-familiarly ignores referendum. It’s an old story” (9 letters and the answer’s at the bottom).

What I’ve never done, so far, is “become foreign secretary”. The thought has not even occurred. And yet it would provide amusement for a few months, cutting off relations with Pakistan, being rude to African dictators, sending free arms to Israel and hosting cheerful summit meetings with that new chap in Brazil, who seems a promising and congenial sort.

But, as I say, it has never occurred. This is probably because
